body_html:
Alex is right. You can't do a simple split. The TensorArray split, concat, stack, and unstack ops aren't optimized. Sadly. This requires someone with time and GPU expertise. Look at the code for TF.concat I think for an example. On Wed, Jul 18, 2018, 8:42 AM Alexandre Passos <notifications@github.com> wrote:
…
The split operation there is needed to ensure that the split tensors don't end up out of eigen alignment, I believe. On Tue, Jul 17, 2018 at 10:17 PM Yingkai Luan ***@***.***> wrote: > @alextp <https://github.com/alextp> hi! > > I checked tensor array ops' code, and found some very expensive operation, > like: > > > https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/81161f9d9987a8eb70793d95048c20be34292859/tensorflow/core/kernels/tensor_array_ops.cc#L1329-L1331 > > I modify the code and let the split act as trivial, then the total running > time reduce to about 30s with the same device. > > I also notice that tensorarray's scatter has some mutex operation, so it > should be a little bit slower. Maybe a fused_split can help with > performance. > > — > You are receiving this because you were mentioned. > Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub > < #19733 (comment) >, > or mute the thread > < https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAATxcotdWY-1S23d_KZV9sE8XThoeDaks5uHsTLgaJpZM4UYafN > > . > -- - Alex — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#19733 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABtimxOEfCz00AaGy5fPXqgd1EwmnFhGks5uH1dygaJpZM4UYafN> .
body_text:
Alex is right. You can't do a simple split.

The TensorArray split, concat, stack, and unstack ops aren't optimized.
Sadly.  This requires someone with time and GPU expertise.  Look at the
code for TF.concat I think for an example.

On Wed, Jul 18, 2018, 8:42 AM Alexandre Passos <notifications@github.com>
wrote:
…
 The split operation there is needed to ensure that the split tensors don't
 end up out of eigen alignment, I believe.

 On Tue, Jul 17, 2018 at 10:17 PM Yingkai Luan ***@***.***>
 wrote:

 > @alextp <https://github.com/alextp> hi!
 >
 > I checked tensor array ops' code, and found some very expensive
 operation,
 > like:
 >
 >
 >
 https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/81161f9d9987a8eb70793d95048c20be34292859/tensorflow/core/kernels/tensor_array_ops.cc#L1329-L1331
 >
 > I modify the code and let the split act as trivial, then the total
 running
 > time reduce to about 30s with the same device.
 >
 > I also notice that tensorarray's scatter has some mutex operation, so it
 > should be a little bit slower. Maybe a fused_split can help with
 > performance.
 >
 > —
 > You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
 > Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 > <
 #19733 (comment)
 >,
 > or mute the thread
 > <
 https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAATxcotdWY-1S23d_KZV9sE8XThoeDaks5uHsTLgaJpZM4UYafN
 >
 > .
 >


 --
 - Alex

body:
Alex is right. You can't do a simple split.

The TensorArray split, concat, stack, and unstack ops aren't optimized.
Sadly.  This requires someone with time and GPU expertise.  Look at the
code for TF.concat I think for an example.

On Wed, Jul 18, 2018, 8:42 AM Alexandre Passos <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> The split operation there is needed to ensure that the split tensors don't
> end up out of eigen alignment, I believe.
>
> On Tue, Jul 17, 2018 at 10:17 PM Yingkai Luan <notifications@github.com>
> wrote:
>
> > @alextp <https://github.com/alextp> hi!
> >
> > I checked tensor array ops' code, and found some very expensive
> operation,
> > like:
> >
> >
> >
> https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/81161f9d9987a8eb70793d95048c20be34292859/tensorflow/core/kernels/tensor_array_ops.cc#L1329-L1331
> >
> > I modify the code and let the split act as trivial, then the total
> running
> > time reduce to about 30s with the same device.
> >
> > I also notice that tensorarray's scatter has some mutex operation, so it
> > should be a little bit slower. Maybe a fused_split can help with
> > performance.
> >
> > —
> > You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> > Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> > <
> https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/19733#issuecomment-405811189
> >,
> > or mute the thread

> >
> > .
> >
>
>
> --
> - Alex
